solution_line_template: When she poured water into the gallon for {pour_time_minutes} minutes, the total time in seconds she took is {pour_time_minutes} minutes * {seconds_per_minute} seconds/minute = <<{pour_time_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute}={total_time_seconds}>>{total_time_seconds} seconds.

If in {time_per_gallon} seconds she poured {gallons_per_interval} gallon of water into the tank, in {total_time_seconds} seconds, she poured {total_time_seconds} seconds / {time_per_gallon} seconds/gallon = <<{total_time_seconds}/{time_per_gallon}/{gallons_per_interval}={gallons_poured}>>{gallons_poured} gallons of water into the tank.
Aubriella will have to pour {tank_capacity} gallons - {gallons_poured} gallons = <<{tank_capacity}-{gallons_poured}={gallons_needed}>>{gallons_needed} more gallons into the tank to fill the tank.
